skill.name: ask-user
skill.description: Pattern for effectively interacting with users to gather information or get decisions. Use when you need user input.

skill.author: Clouder0

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code. It provides guidance for AI agents on how to interact with users using the AskUserQuestion tool. No scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or external commands present.

content.value_statement: AI agents often lack clarity on user requirements. This skill provides patterns for asking targeted questions that gather exactly what you need to proceed effectively.
actual_capabilities: Guide AI agents to ask specific rather than open-ended questions
Present multiple-choice options to users for decision making
Batch related questions to reduce back-and-forth
Provide context and trade-offs when asking for decisions
limitations: Only works with agents that support the AskUserQuestion tool
Does not execute code or access files
Cannot make decisions on your behalf

use_cases.title: Clarify project scope
use_cases.description: Use structured questions to understand exact requirements before implementation begins

use_cases.title: Resolve technical decisions
use_cases.description: Present technology choices with pros and cons for user selection

use_cases.title: Reduce clarification loops
use_cases.description: Batch related questions and provide context to minimize user interaction cycles

prompt_templates.title: Clarify vague requirements
prompt_templates.prompt: The user said they want the app to be 'fast'. Ask them to clarify whether they mean response time, load time, or development speed.

prompt_templates.title: Present tech choices
prompt_templates.prompt: Present three database options with their trade-offs: PostgreSQL for relational data, MongoDB for flexible schemas, Redis for caching. Ask which fits their use case.

prompt_templates.title: Confirm understanding
prompt_templates.prompt: Summarize the requirements you understood and ask the user to confirm before proceeding with the build.

prompt_templates.title: Define scope boundary
prompt_templates.prompt: Ask whether a feature should also handle edge cases or just the main use case. Provide examples of what is included versus excluded.

output: I understand you want faster search. To help you best, I have a few questions:
â€¢ What does 'faster' mean to you? (response time under 100ms, faster than current, instant)
â€¢ What is your current search implementation? (database full-text, external service, custom)
â€¢ How many records are you searching through? (hundreds, thousands, millions)

best_practices: Always provide context about why you are asking and what depends on the answer
Offer concrete options with descriptions rather than asking open-ended questions
Batch related questions together to reduce interaction cycles
Distinguish between questions you should ask versus decisions you should make
anti_patterns: Asking 'What do you want?' without any specific options or context
Making assumptions instead of asking for clarification
Asking multiple unrelated questions in separate interactions instead of batching
Presenting options without explaining trade-offs or recommendations

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Claude, Codex, and Claude Code all support the AskUserQuestion tool that this skill patterns.

faq.question: What is the maximum number of questions I can ask?
faq.answer: The skill recommends batching related questions together, typically 3-4 questions per interaction.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my workflow?
faq.answer: Load the skill when you encounter ambiguity. The skill provides patterns for structuring your questions.

faq.question: Does this skill collect or store user data?
faq.answer: No. This is a documentation skill providing patterns. User data handling depends on the host AI tool.

faq.question: Why is my agent asking too many questions?
faq.answer: Review the skill patterns. Batch related questions and provide context to reduce back-and-forth.

faq.question: How is this different from regular conversation?
faq.answer: The skill provides structured patterns for gathering specific information efficiently with options and context.
